attends prestigious Shaffer Conservatory in New York City hoping to leave a legacy like that of his idol Buddy Rich.
Recruited by Terence Fletcher, the conductor of the Shaffer Conservatory Studio Band, to play in the Studio ensemble as an alternate for core drummer Carl Tanner.

node_2: core drummer for terence fletcher's studio ensemble
edge: Andrew is recruited as an alternate for core drummer Carl Tanner in Terence Fletcher's Studio ensemble.

strict and verbally and physically abusive towards his students. When Andrew fails to keep tempo on Hank Levy's 'Whiplash' during his first ensemble rehearsal, Fletcher throws a chair at him, slaps his face, and berates him.
slights Tanner by replacing him with Andrew during their first set at a jazz competition after Andrew misplaces Tanner's sheet music.
misplaces Tanner's sheet music during their first set at a jazz competition, causing Fletcher to replace him with Andrew.
Fletcher abruptly reassigns the core drummer position from Andrew to Ryan Connolly, a drummer from a lower-level ensemble within Shaffer.
clashes with his family and breaks up with Nicole, to focus on his ambitions.
Begins rehearsal by announcing that Sean Casey, a former member of the Studio Band, died in a car accident.
Pushes the three drummers to play at a faster tempo on 'Caravan', keeping them for a grueling five-hour practice before Andrew earns back the core position.
Arrives late to the next competition due to his bus getting a flat tire.
Forgets his drumsticks at the rental office, irritating Fletcher.
His car is hit by a truck on the way back, leaving him heavily injured and he crawls from the wreckage and runs to the theater, arriving bloodied.
crawls from the wreckage and runs to the theater, arriving bloodied and weak just as the ensemble enters the stage
Attacks Fletcher onstage and as a result is expelled from Shaffer.
Suffers from depression and anxiety inflicted by Fletcher's abuse.
Meets a lawyer representing the parents of the late Sean Casey.
edge1: Reluctantly agrees to testify anonymously, leading Shaffer to terminate Fletcher.

edge: Encounters Fletcher months later playing piano at a jazz club.
edge1: Over a drink, Fletcher admits his teaching methods were harsh but insists they were necessary to motivate his students.

edge: Cites a story where Jo Jones allegedly threw a cymbal at Charlie Parker as an example.
edge1: Fletcher says that the next jazz musician to live up to Parker's legacy would never let discouragement stop them.

edge: Calls Nicole to invite her to the performance but learns she is in a new relationship.
edge1: Fletcher tells Andrew he knows he testified against him.

edge: the short film 'Right of Way' debuted at the Sundance Film Festival and received acclaim
writer-director Damien Chazelle wrote the film 'Whiplash' initially in frustration while trying to get his musical 'La La Land' off the ground
Neiman was portrayed by Johnny Simmons in the short film 'Right of Way'
Fletcher was portrayed by J. K. Simmons (no relation) in the short film 'Right of Way'
writer-director Damien Chazelle was in a Studio Band while attending Princeton High School
conductor Terence Fletcher was based on Chazelle's former band instructor in the film 'Whiplash'
elements of Buddy Rich were added to the character of Terence Fletcher in the film 'Whiplash'
Financing for the feature-length film was made possible by the success of the script at the Sundance Film Festival, which attracted investors.
Both actors appeared in the short film version of the script and Miles Teller took on the role originated by Johnny Simmons for the feature-length version.
Chazelle encouraged J. K. Simmons to portray a monster, gargoyle, or animal instead of a human being in the film.
Chazelle tried to capture the expressions of fear and anxiety on the faces of real musicians and music students when directed by J. K. Simmons.
Miles Teller performed much of the drumming seen in the film as he had taught himself to play drums at age fifteen.
Principal photography for the film took place at the Hotel Barclay.
Principal photography for the film took place at the Palace Theater.
Principal photography for the film took place at the Orpheum Theatre.

opened in a limited release on October 10, 2014
As of October 3, 2024, Whiplash grossed $14 million in the U.S. And Canada and $36.3 million in other territories, for a worldwide total of $50.4 million against a budget of $3.3 million.
expanded nationwide to 1000 locations
finally expanded nationwide to 1000 locations to capitalize on receiving five Academy Awards nominations.
Rotten Tomatoes score
Metacritic score
won the 2015 Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor.
Peter Debruge's review

Simmons delivers a captivating performance in the film 'Whiplash', which showcases his character's profanity and unconventional behavior. The character is complex and compelling, making him an exciting co-lead part for Simmons.

Chazelle's direction and editing in 'Whiplash' are sharp, gripping, and beautifully edited by Tom Cross. The film has a rhythm that is both informative and patient with its characters and the things that matter to them.
In 'Whiplash', Chazelle's film professes its love for both music and characters equally. It is a rare film about music that does not sacrifice either the music or the characters.
In 'Whiplash', Fletcher isn't making a Charlie Parker, but rather, a type of musician who would throw a cymbal at him. This distorts jazz history and promotes a misleading idea of genius.
In 'Whiplash', Chazelle doesn't honor neither jazz nor cinema.
The New Yorker critic Richard Brody stated that the film 'Whiplash' does not honor jazz.
Brody also remarked that the film doesn't appreciate cinema.

The feature-length version of 'Whiplash' was originally planned to compete for the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay, but it ultimately contested in the Adapted Screenplay category due to the short film version premiering at the 2013 Sundance Film Festival.
The feature-length film's script was written before the short version, and the latter was produced to attract investors for the former.
The feature-length film 'Whiplash' won the top audience and grand jury awards in the U.S. dramatic competition at the 2014 Sundance Film Festival.
Chazelle's short film of the same name received the jury award in the U.S. fiction category at the 2013 Sundance Film Festival.
The film appeared on many critics' end-of-year lists.
Metacritic analyzed the lists published by major film critics and publications, recording that 'Whiplash' appeared on 57 lists in total.
Overall the film was ranked in 5th place for the year by Metacritic.
The feature-length film 'Whiplash' also took the grand prize and the audience award for its favorite film at the 40th Deauville American Film Festival.
The Writers Guild of America categorized the screenplay as original.
At the 87th Academy Awards, AMPAS classed it as an adaptation of the 2013 short version.
J. K. Simmons received the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his performance.

edge: In 2024, it topped the list of the Sundance Film Festival's Top 10 Films of All Time as the result of a survey conducted with 500 filmmakers and critics in honor of the festival's 40th anniversary.
To celebrate the film's 10th anniversary, a new 4K remaster of the film was released theatrically on September 20, 2024,
